mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Julia B.[owen] & the Society of Females to Martha Washington, 1800 February 14
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bowen, Julia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Condolence note from Julia Bowen & the Society of Females (Mary Howell, Sarah Halsey and Abby Chase) of Providence, Rhode Island. "Hoping that their condolence letter is not taken to be presumptuous," four women write to Martha Washington that their fathers fought with George Washington--therefore they request a lock of his hair, however small, as a memento--in a postscript, they also request a lock of Martha Washington's hair. (See: copy of Martha Washington's reply, dated March 12, 1800). Autograph letter signed, 2 pages.
